main event: A bright elliptical object was observed from a ship in the Pacific, moving in a southerly direction with intermittent periods of visibility.
interesting points: The object was observed at an elevation of 2000 yards, with its light on constantly.
The object had a definite outline and no appendages.
The sighting lasted for 15 minutes, with the object's visibility alternating between 5 seconds and 20 seconds.
The weather conditions included warm rain squalls in the area.
The sighting was reported by multiple personnel on the USS Durant, including the Officer of the Deck and lookouts, who described the object as 'excellent' in their observations.
